App description:
Discover the dreams, fears and secrets of othersand leave your own for others to find.

In this award-winning social experience, human thoughts exist as sleeping creatures that can be awakened to reveal voice-recorded stories of other participants who were here before you. These anonymous stories are revealing and inspiring, encouraging reflection and introspection. To progress, you must leave your own stories behind for others to uncover

Visually beautiful and wholly transformative, Where Thoughts Go thematically explores the course of a lifetime through five simple questions written to dig deep. The voice recordings you hear are unique and unidentifiable, left by individuals from every walk of life, every age and every background. Participants have no way to discern who they are hearing from, only how considerate and sensitive each and every person is. 

This project is under development. Join our Community at http://WhereThoughtsGo.Me/Community and be part of the process!

An interesting experience

You sit in one place and grab floating orbs out of the air to listen to recorded answers to questions, and then you record your own anonymous answer to each question which will be listened to by other players in turn. It's peaceful, or might be called boring. I thought from the trailer that there would be more interactivity to it. Maybe if there were some hidden orbs that you had to find, or if they were little people on the ground instead of disembodied orbs, something where you had to *do* something, or if each environment was related to the question and you felt like you were going on a journey through life as the questions progressed.

Anyway, it was nice to answer some of the questions. A few of them made me feel heavily emotional and I cried on one of them.

To the developer: Unfortunately, after the end of the main question series, I encountered a bug. After finishing the 5th question, I handed my recording to the little round black guy. Everything went black, and there was just a single point of white light straight ahead. I waited for a couple of minutes, and nothing happened. Finally I pressed the menu button and chose "go back home" or whatever it's called, then the game crashed. When I opened it back up, my progress had all been lost, and all the questions were locked. There is no indication if my recordings were saved or not. This also means that I couldn't access any of the bonus questions. So, my suggestion is that progress should be saved after every question.

A Scam?

You are asked a question, and you can hear the answers left by other users, before you can leave your own. You listen to these sound bites by touching one of around 10 to 20 bubble faces meant to represent users. The answer you leave can be 'found' by other users. This is the theory behind the experience , if I understand correctly.

In practice, the voices seem scripted and recorded in the same professional environment. The accents are all very similar, so is the age-bracket of the people doing the voices. The age of the actor and the content are also often mismatched, making the experience more like a college class project than the output of a genuine audience.

I found no way of discovering more than the 10 to 20 odd soundbites for each question. All similarly styled and voiced. Where are the real user sound bites? How do the devs filter out profanity and poor quality sound bites left by users? Who gets to choose? How are they managing to keep up as the user base grows? The model seems totally non-scalable for a small company, which is why this feels more like a scam than a genuine experience.

Also, there is absolutely no useful use of VR. This could have just as easily been a phone App, and not a good one at that. I am confused.
